t: Luke 22
The Plot to Kill Jesus
Now*p the Feast of Unleavened Bread drew near, which is called Passover.
And the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might kill Him, for they feared the people.
Then*p Satan entered Judas, surnamed Iscariot, who was numbered among the twelve.
So he went his way and conferred with the chief priests and captains, how he might betray Him to them.
And they were glad, and agreed to give him money.
So he promised and sought opportunity to betray Him to them in the absence of the multitude.
Jesus and His Disciples Prepare the Passover
Then*p came the Day of Unleavened Bread, when the Passover must be killed.
And He sent Peter and John, saying, “Go*r and*r prepare*r the*r Passover*r for*r us,*r that*r we*r may*r eat.”*r
So*p they said to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare?”

And*p He said to them, “Behold,*r when*r you*r have*r entered*r the*r city,*r a*r man*r will*r meet*r you*r carrying*r a*r pitcher*r of*r water;*r follow*r him*r into*r the*r house*r which*r he*r enters.*r

Then*r you*r shall*r say*r to*r the*r master*r of*r the*r house,*r ‘The*r Teacher*r says*r to*r you,*r “Where*r is*r the*r guest*r room*r where*r I*r may*r eat*r the*r Passover*r with*r My*r disciples?”’*r
Then*r he*r will*r show*r you*r a*r large,*r furnished*r upper*r room;*r there*r make*r ready.”*r
So*p they went and found it just as He had said to them, and they prepared the Passover.
Jesus Institutes the Lord’s Supper
When*p the hour had come, He sat down, and the twelve apostles with Him.
Then He said to them, “With*r fervent*ir desire*r I*r have*r desired*r to*r eat*r this*r Passover*r with*r you*r before*r I*r suffer;*r
for*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r will*r no*r longer*r eat*r of*r it*r until*r it*r is*r fulfilled*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
Then*p He took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, “Take*r this*r and*r divide*r it*ir among*r yourselves;*r
for*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r will*r not*r drink*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine*r until*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r comes.”*r
And*p He took bread, gave thanks and broke it,*i and gave it*i to them, saying, “This*r is*r My*r body*r which*r is*r given*r for*r you;*r do*r this*r in*r remembrance*r of*r Me.”*r
Likewise*p He also took*i the cup after supper, saying, “This*r cup*r is*ir the*r new*r covenant*r in*r My*r blood,*r which*r is*r shed*r for*r you.*r
But*r behold,*r the*r hand*r of*r My*r betrayer*r is*ir with*r Me*r on*r the*r table.*r
And*r truly*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r goes*r as*r it*r has*r been*r determined,*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r He*r is*r betrayed!”*r
Then*p they began to question among themselves, which of them it was who would do this thing.
The Disciples Argue About Greatness
Now*p there was also a dispute among them, as to which of them should be considered the greatest.
And He said to them, “The*r kings*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r exercise*r lordship*r over*r them,*r and*r those*r who*r exercise*r authority*r over*r them*r are*r called*r ‘benefactors.’*r
But*r not*r so*r among*ir you;*r on*r the*r contrary,*r he*r who*r is*r greatest*r among*r you,*r let*r him*r be*r as*r the*r younger,*r and*r he*r who*r governs*r as*r he*r who*r serves.*r

For*r who*r is*ir greater,*r he*r who*r sits*r at*r the*r table,*r or*r he*r who*r serves?*r Is*ir it*r not*r he*r who*r sits*r at*r the*r table?*r Yet*r I*r am*r among*r you*r as*r the*r One*r who*r serves.*r
“But*rp you*r are*r those*r who*r have*r continued*r with*r Me*r in*r My*r trials.*r
And*r I*r bestow*r upon*r you*r a*r kingdom,*r just*r as*r My*r Father*r bestowed*r one*ir upon*r Me,*r
that*r you*r may*r eat*r and*r drink*r at*r My*r table*r in*r My*r kingdom,*r and*r sit*r on*r thrones*r judging*r the*r twelve*r tribes*r of*r Israel.”*r
Jesus Predicts Peter’s Denial
And*p the Lord said, “Simon,*r Simon!*r Indeed,*r Satan*r has*r asked*r for*r you,*r that*r he*r may*r sift*r you*ir as*r wheat.*r
But*r I*r have*r prayed*r for*r you,*r that*r your*r faith*r should*r not*r fail;*r and*r when*r you*r have*r returned*r to*r Me,*ir strengthen*r your*r brethren.”*r
But*p he said to Him, “Lord, I am ready to go with You, both to prison and to death.”
Then*p He said, “I*r tell*r you,*r Peter,*r the*r rooster*r shall*r not*r crow*r this*r day*r before*r you*r will*r deny*r three*r times*r that*r you*r know*r Me.”*r
Supplies for the Road
And*p He said to them, “When*r I*r sent*r you*r without*r money*r bag,*r knapsack,*r and*r sandals,*r did*r you*r lack*r anything?”*r So*p they said, “Nothing.”

Then*p He said to them, “But*r now,*r he*r who*r has*r a*r money*r bag,*r let*r him*r take*r it,*ir and*r likewise*r a*r knapsack;*r and*r he*r who*r has*r no*r sword,*r let*r him*r sell*r his*r garment*r and*r buy*r one.*r

For*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r this*r which*r is*r written*r must*r still*r be*r accomplished*r in*r Me:*r ‘And*r He*r was*r numbered*r with*r the*r transgressors.’*r For*r the*r things*r concerning*r Me*r have*r an*r end.”*r
So*p they said, “Lord, look, here are*i two swords.” And*p He said to them, “It*r is*r enough.”*r
The Prayer in the Garden
Coming*p out, He went to the Mount of Olives, as He was accustomed, and His disciples also followed Him.
When He came to the place, He said to them, “Pray*r that*r you*r may*r not*r enter*r into*r temptation.”*r
And*p He was withdrawn from them about a stone’s throw, and He knelt down and prayed,
saying, “Father,*r if*r it*r is*r Your*r will,*r take*r this*r cup*r away*r from*r Me;*r nevertheless*r not*r My*r will,*r but*r Yours,*r be*r done.”*r
Then an angel appeared to Him from heaven, strengthening Him.
And being in agony, He prayed more earnestly. Then His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down to the ground.
When*p He rose up from prayer, and had come to His disciples, He found them sleeping from sorrow.
Then He said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r sleep?*r Rise*r and*r pray,*r lest*r you*r enter*r into*r temptation.”*r
Betrayal and Arrest in Gethsemane
And*p while He was still speaking, behold, a multitude; and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, went before them and drew near to Jesus to kiss Him.
But Jesus said to him, “Judas,*r are*r you*r betraying*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r with*r a*r kiss?”*r
When*p those around Him saw what was going to happen, they said to Him, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
And one of them struck the servant of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
But*p Jesus answered and said, “Permit*r even*r this.”*r And He touched his ear and healed him.
Then*p Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and the elders who had come to Him, “Have*r you*r come*r out,*r as*r against*r a*r robber,*r with*r swords*r and*r clubs?*r
When*r I*r was*r with*r you*r daily*r in*r the*r temple,*r you*r did*r not*r try*r to*r seize*r Me.*r But*r this*r is*r your*r hour,*r and*r the*r power*r of*r darkness.”*r
Peter Denies Jesus, and Weeps Bitterly
Having*p arrested Him, they led Him*i and brought Him into the high priest’s house. But Peter followed at a distance.
Now when they had kindled a fire in the midst of the courtyard and sat down together, Peter sat among them.
And a certain servant girl, seeing him as he sat by the fire, looked intently at him and said, “This man was also with Him.”
But*p he denied Him, saying, “Woman, I do not know Him.”
And*p after a little while another saw him and said, “You also are of them.” But*p Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
Then*p after about an hour had passed, another confidently affirmed, saying, “Surely this fellow*i also was with Him, for he is a Galilean.”
But*p Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are saying!” Immediately,*p while he was still speaking, the rooster crowed.
And the Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had said to him, “Before*r the*r rooster*r crows,*r you*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r
So Peter went out and wept bitterly.
Jesus Mocked and Beaten
Now*p the men who held Jesus mocked Him and beat Him.
And having blindfolded Him, they struck Him on the face and asked Him, saying, “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck You?”
And many other things they blasphemously spoke against Him.
Jesus Faces the Sanhedrin
As*p soon as it was day, the elders of the people, both chief priests and scribes, came together and led Him into their council, saying,
“If You are the Christ, tell us.” But*p He said to them, “If*r I*r tell*r you,*r you*r will*r by*r no*r means*r believe.*r
And*r if*r I*r also*r ask*r you,*ir you*r will*r by*r no*r means*r answer*r Me*r or*r let*r Me*ir go.*r
Hereafter*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r sit*r on*r the*r right*r hand*r of*r the*r power*r of*r God.”*r
Then*p they all said, “Are You then the Son of God?” So*p He said to them, “You*r rightly*ir say*r that*r I*r am.”*r
And*p they said, “What further testimony do we need? For we have heard it ourselves from His own mouth.”
